abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement action plan (RAP) is
            based on Madagascar's legal, and regulatory framework,
            and on the Bank's guidelines, and procedures regarding
            resettlement, and, sets the policy framework to be taken
            regarding the displacement of populations as a result of the
            Second Rural Transport Project implementation, which
            includes ports, and road infrastructure, railways and
            navigational waterways. The principles of compensation,
            based on a participatory approach, and consultations with
            project affected populations (PAPs), stipulate that property
            losses, both permanent or temporary, will be compensated
            either at replacement costs, or in cash, as will income
            losses stemming from the implementation of the project. The
            project framework takes into consideration the occurrence of
            involuntary resettlement, safeguarded by the Bank's
            operational procedures (rule no. 4.12). A monitoring
            criteria, including grievance mechanisms will guide the
            resettlement process.
